title: Will NFL quarterback Aaron Rodgers sign a player contract with an NFL team other than the Green Bay Packers before 9 September 2021?
preds: Aaron has too much invested in this franchise to leave it without a solid second string QB. Additionally he hasn’t been performing up to expectations in the past couple years, which makes him less attractive to other franchises.
He is slow to change, prefers comfort regardless of his disposition. He could have opted out before his last contract.

Packers agree to trade for Randall Cobb, fulfilling Aaron Rodgers' request; Cobb tweets approval. 
https://www.cbssports.com/nfl/news/packers-reportedly-agree-to-trade-for-randall-cobb-fulfilling-aaron-rodgers-request-cobb-tweets-approval
If he is traded it is after the forecast. They would not give him an advantage to learn the west coast, etc,. strategy but trade him into season for draft picks.
He does not want to play for Green Bay and he is a tremendously talented player. Rodgers has power.

John Kuhn does a daily radio show here
https://www.iheart.com/live/973-the-game-2685/

A new ripple in the force: 
Aaron Rodgers does indeed have an opt-out silver bullet for 2021... The benefit to doing so comes from the fact that he would not forfeit $11.5 million in unearned signing bonus money for 2021 if he opts out. Also, he presumably would still receive the payments on the $6.8 million roster bonus that he earned in March, and that is due to be paid out in weekly installments during the season. https://www.yahoo.com/sports/aaron-rodgers-does-indeed-opt-103404968.html

Rodgers paid for another year at the Green Bay Golf Country Club.
https://www.msn.com/en-us/sports/nfl/aaron-rodgers-renews-his-membership-at-the-green-bay-country-club/ar-AALdw8j
Every day that goes by the chances go down. I don't see Rodgers sitting out and I think the chances of being traded are even slimmer.

The Lions are the forever rebuilding team, one of the old teams that never went to the Super Bowl, Stafford was traded but he never led them to a championship.  Goff is good, but has not much talent on Lions to win enough games in Detroit. The Vikings implode and their QB is not exceptional, and the Bears never had a QB centered strategy or an exceptional QB. Rodgers, minus injury, will go to the championship. If he went to another division he wants, if they want him, will have tougher teams in their own neighborhood and lineup and a first place is much tougher . Based on schedule, they are at least a 13 win year if All Pro potential Packers are not injured. 
Unless Rodgers, 37, goes to an all in box team like the Buccaneers (not a chance) for one of the more easy football schedules, Rodgers' best opportunity for an MVP is with the Packers. Then next year, his world is his oyster.

Rodgers want the GM fired, Packers already said that ain't happening. Packers also said they'll trade him if they actually believe he won't come back. Rodgers has an extremely stubborn personality so I think when says he won't play for them again unless the gm is fired, he means it. My uncertainty is in the timing of this question. Not sure if Packers would force him to retire (try to call the bluff) and then trade him in season or if they'll just trade him as soon as he misses a preseason game/training camp.  I think it's more likely than not but it's close. I think incentives for Packers will set in when they realize he's not coming back and they might as well get a haul of picks from the Broncos for him (assuming they're being truthful in that they won't fire the GM). Basically, I fully believe in the stubbornness of Aaron Rodgers, but I don't have a good grasp on how stubborn the Packers GM/owner will be.
He’s unhappy with team ownership but not with the guys he plays with. I believe he is mire likely to sit out then sign with another team.
Rodgers has had chances before. His best chance to win is more likely with GB

Not unless they want Green Bay opinion to riot and lose fans.  It is becoming rather late for him to change teams and re-structure a new team. The Packers were one game away from the Super Bowl and there was contention regarding the field goal, but mistakes are made in championships and players return. If Rodgers misses camp, it is a non-issue, If he sits out pre-season, who cares? There is no reason for him to play until the NFL matters in games. 
The Packers continually dissed him with firing his QB coach and releasing players whom he had partnered with on the receiving team. A first round QB draft pick who is mediocre, and never first drafted a receiver in all his experience with Green Bay. The Packers draft new inexperienced NFL players and therefore they are more dependent on him. He has the upper hand. He is an MVP and brand and could afford to sit out until an agreement is signed with him. If he says it is a philosophical issue than he is in it for the money. The Packers will win the division because no team is ready to defend it and go on at least to the championship. The teams that he wants to allegedly join are not Super Bowl teams and because he will have more competition in the division, first place in a trade is not a lead pipe cinch for him.
Just reaffirming the 0% chance. With Julio Jones off the table, there is very little that GB can give Rodgers that would make him want to stay.
One more year in Green Bay seems most likely at this time

Aaron Rodgers is too valuable to the Green Bay Packers image that he will be black-balled from other teams and his contract will sit in limbo. Jordan Love has enough skill to take over the playbook and play well with Aaron Jones and Davante Adams. Rodgers will likely sit out all of preseason and only come back if the GM is fired and other leadership positions are consolidated and replaced.
